summary: This document is an email chain regarding the procurement and overnight shipping of surveillance cameras (20 dome IP cameras, 5 180-degree IP cameras, 2 PTZ dome IP cameras) for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York project. The correspondence involves a Program Manager from FBOP Contracts at SigNet Technologies and a Communication Technician at the US Department of Justice's MCC-New York facility.

persons.name: Program Manager FBOP Contracts
persons.context: Sender of the email from SigNet Technologies, requesting to overnight cameras for the MCC New York project and attaching a confidentiality notice.

persons.name: Communication Technician
persons.context: Recipient of the email at the US Department of Justice's MCC-New York facility, involved in the camera procurement project.

connections.description: Business correspondence regarding procurement of surveillance equipment for the MCC New York facility.

events.title: Camera Procurement Request for MCC New York
events.description: A Program Manager from SigNet Technologies emails a Communication Technician at MCC New York to request overnight shipping of surveillance cameras for a project, aiming to mock up a unit before installation.

locations: MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
keyFacts: The document is dated March 22, 2019, which is after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019, indicating post-arrest activity related to the MCC facility where he was later held.
It involves a request to overnight surveillance cameras (20 dome IP, 5 180-degree IP, 2 PTZ dome IP) for the MCC New York project, suggesting upgrades or installations at the correctional center.
The correspondence is between a SigNet Technologies Program Manager and a US Department of Justice Communication Technician at MCC New York, highlighting contractor-DOJ collaboration.
The email includes a confidentiality notice from SigNet Technologies, indicating the sensitive nature of the communication.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, possibly related to facility management or security at MCC New York where Epstein was incarcerated.
